title: BccKing
author: BccKing
content: The manager of bitcointalk deleted my discussion in the altcoin section. In fact, I just want more people to follow bitcoin and be careful about the risks of the altcoin. There is no other meaning. But the rules of the forum are too restrictive to allow me to speak freely, and I don't like being restricted, so I may not come back to the forum to speak in the future. Finally, thanks to the believers who participated in the discussion in https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5410187.0, thank you!

comments.author: Oshosondy
comments.body: This should be on reputation board, not bitcoin discussion.I have seen this forum to be one of the forums you can express yourself, but spam and irrelevant posts are deleted. You can decide to stay if you just want to be among people that are discussing about bitcoin, crypto generally and other related discussions. You have your choice to make, the forum takes nothing from you and do not force anyone to stay, do your wish, but this is a nice forum and I do not experience anything like restriction since I have been posting on this forum.

comments.author: Timelord2067
comments.body: All this for an account with 107 activity?

comments.author: YOSHIE
comments.body: Mod, no desire to delete your message in that altcoin section, except: you were detected and violated some rules in this forum.for example:Quote from: mprep on July 21, 2014, 05:27:51 PM1. No zero or low value, pointless or uninteresting posts or threads. [1][e]2. No off-topic posts.3. No trolling.4. No referral code (ref link) spam. [1]I strongly suspect that among the four written rules, one or two of them you violated or you don't know it.I think this forum is not suitable for you, some of your posts have been deleted, you have blamed others, you should read some of the rules first before starting to write and fix where you made mistakes don't be pessimistic.But that's okay, if you want to leave this forum, hopefully you can get a better insight into Bitcoin/crypto out there, if you want take care of your emotions and stay positive out there.

comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: Quote from: BccKing on August 21, 2022, 10:43:00 AMBut the rules of the forum are too restrictive to allow me to speak freely, and I don't like being restricted, so I may not come back to the forum to speak in the future.Many would not agree with you and I am certainly one of those who think that the rules of the forum are no obstacle to writing freely, but that at the same time you adhere to the rules that it all makes sense and is placed in the correct board. Quote from: BccKing on August 21, 2022, 10:43:00 AMThe manager of bitcointalk deleted my discussion in the altcoin sectionDo you know why it was deleted? I assume that someone reported that topic because you just copied your post from the topic you mention in the OP - in other words, it makes no sense to have the same discussion in two different boards. It has nothing to do with that anyone wants to prevent you in any way "to speak freely".https://ninjastic.space/post/60767449  -->  https://ninjastic.space/post/60767464

comments.author: Rikafip
comments.body: Quote from: BccKing on August 21, 2022, 10:43:00 AM But the rules of the forum are too restrictive to allow me to speak freely, and I don't like being restricted, so I may not come back to the forum to speak in the future.If you think that rules on bitcointalk are too restrictive that only means you aren't really experienced with forums. As someone who is on various forums for ~20 years, I can say that bitcointalk is by far the least restrictive forum I was ever part of. I advise you to grow a thicker skin otherwise you will have a hard time anywhere else.

comments.author: Falconer
comments.body: Quote from: BccKing on August 21, 2022, 10:43:00 AMBut the rules of the forum are too restrictive to allow me to speak freely, and I don't like being restricted, so I may not come back to the forum to speak in the future.Nothing is preventing you and others from having free speech in this forum, so you have unwittingly drawn the wrong conclusion about it. You just need to evaluate what you have done so that the moderators delete your post, this is a different matter than what you call free speech.Having thick skin is the best advice for the current situation but if your interest in being in the forum has dropped then take a break and come back when you have better interests and feelings. But believe me, deleting posts that violate the rules based on the moderator's interpretation is not a valid reason to say you are prohibited from speaking. You must obey the rules, so you should know more about the rules so that in the future not many of your posts are deleted.

comments.author: The Sceptical Chymist
comments.body: OP, you've been here presumably since 2017 and you're just now finding the forum to be too restrictive for your liking?  That seems odd to me, bordering on suspicious, especially since you recently posted this:Quote from: BccKing on August 17, 2022, 02:16:49 PMok, thanks for the reminder, i don't understand the forum rules yetSo I'd say if your point is to leave bitcointalk, it's been made and good luck to you wherever you go.  This forum isn't for everyone.Edit: Ah, I didn't realize it was a known fact OP's account had changed hands.  I blanked out my trust list, so it seems like nothing shows up as red anymore.  In any case, bye bye OP.  If this forum is too rough for you, you're gonna have one hell of a time on the rest of the interwebz.

comments.author: LTU_btc
comments.body: Oh no, please don't leave us! How forum is going to live without you? Seriously, dude, it's not train station and there is no need to announce about your departure. Especially when you haven't contributed much here.You didn't follow forum rules when you made duplicate topic and now you're complaining that mod deleted. Ok, if you don't like rules here, you're free to leave. But as others already said, Bitcointalk gives much more freedom than most of forums.

comments.author: KingsDen
comments.body: Op, by chance you are reading this and haven't left totally, I took some minutes to observe your account and understood what really happened. The forum is not as strict as you alleged. We have different sections in this forum. The altcoin section is among them, this forum is where Ethereum project was started and promoted, this means it's a forum that accommodates other cryptocurrencies. You cannot go to the altcoin section and make statements like the one below and expect your post not to be deleted. QuoteI hate altcoins, they made my dad lose money and they are just imitating bitcoin, a lot of altcoins are just to scam money and then disappear, and the real king is bitcoin. So I call on everyone to join me and only believe in Bitcoin, abandon those altcoins that cheat money, and just follow it!The altcoin board is for altcoin believers, you took the took the battle to their territory and you were knocked out.So, it will be nice to believe bitcoin alone and if you have problems with altcoins, just be specific about the particular coin and not trying to defame the whole altcoins.
